title: UI Dev Newsletter
tagline: Stay ahead of the latest UI Dev news
description: Every second Monday, get a shiny list of up to ten free links to stay ahead in the evolving world of User Interface development!
rss_text:
No spam, only quality content. Trusted by more than 800 subscribers.
Don't like newsletters? Subscribe to RSS feed instead.

quotes.name: Eric Bailey
quotes.position: Inclusive design advocate, maintainer of the A11y Project
quotes.text: I’m a big fan of Silvestar’s UI Dev Newsletter. It has a thoughtfully-curated mix of blog posts that are essential to staying on top of all the industry news. I’d enthusiastically recommend subscribing if you’re a frontend-savvy designer or developer looking to learn from the best.

quotes.name: Manuel Matuzović
quotes.position: Frontend developer and consultant, creator of HTMHell
quotes.text: Right now, I have 647 unread items in my RSS reader; it’s hard to keep track of what’s happening in the world of web development. I’m grateful for Silvestar’s UI Dev newsletter, which provides me with a hand-curated list of the most relevant posts twice a month.

quotes.name: Bart Veneman
quotes.position: Frontend architect, creator of Project Wallace
quotes.text: This newsletter is what you would hope your timeline would be: the best articles from around the community summarized in a couple sentences.
